author: potuz
content: <@474451342094499868> I'm wondering are you running regularly with `--dev` on the prysm nodes? have you noticed any difference without it?

author: seamonkey82
content: Yes I added `--dev` to all nodes and haven't noticed any differences.

author: potuz
content: probably good to test also without it since any consensus problem will arise without that flag. We will be running Ropsten without that flag.

author: seamonkey82
content: Maybe set it off for three client pairs and on for the other two, or should I periodically test with all on then all off?  Is it likely that it would cause a conflict in one client pair but not another?

author: potuz
content: Oh that would be perfect. Testing different pairs with different flags should be more than fine. Those flags would affect forkchoice and hashing mostly. If you lots of bad votes on one pair and not the other then it may point to a difference in the implementations

author: seamonkey82
content: It sounds like periodically switching all clients to use or not use `--dev` (maybe once a week) would be the easiest way to ensure that all pairs get tested under both conditions.
